data.title: Harold Lloyd Jr. (1931-1971)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Explore genealogy for Harold Lloyd Jr. born 1931 Beverly Hills, Los Angeles County, California, United States died 1971 North Hollywood, Los Angeles County, California, United States including ancestors + 3 photos + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Ancestors

Profile last modified 31 Mar 2020 | Created 30 May 2018

This page has been accessed 1,546 times.

Biography

"The second child and only son of the silent film comedian Harold Lloyd and actress Mildred Davis, Lloyd made several B-movies in the 1950s and '60s, including The Flaming Urge (1953) (his only starring role) and Frankenstein's Daughter (1958). In 1959, he had a role in the film Girls Town, which featured the son of another famous silent movie comedian, Charles Chaplin Jr."[1]

"He was also given production roles in the compilations of his father's films, released in the early 1960s". [2]

"As a singer he performed in several films, had moderate successes in cabaret in Hollywood and elsewhere, and released an album of romantic ballads in 1965 entitled Intimate Style."[3]

Harold Lloyd, Jr. never married, nor did he have any children. He was briefly engaged to the Chilean actress Marina Cisternas and later to Parisian socialite Irene Barrelet deRicou.[4] According to David Wallace in "A City Comes Out" Harold Jr. was gay.[5]

Harol Lloyd, Jr. suffered a massive stroke in 1965 from which he never fully recovered. He died on June 9, 1971 at the age of 40, three months after the death of his father."[6] His remains were buried at Forest Lawn Memorial Park in Glendale.[7]
